sentence.Network_en: When those idols are found to have feet of clay, the pain of disenchantment can be profound.
sentence.Network_cn: 当人们发现那些偶像有严重的缺陷时，会产生无比痛苦的失落感。

sentence.Network_en: Yet that decision may merely aggravate voters'disenchantment with the EU.
sentence.Network_cn: 然而这一决定或许只会让选民对于欧盟更加不抱幻想.

sentence.Network_en: Steadfast communist ideal and faith are oriented from the theoretical disenchantment.
sentence.Network_cn: 坚定的共产主义理想和信念,来自于理论上的清醒.

英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(D) ... disenchanting 使不再着迷的 disenchantment 觉醒 disencumber 摆脱烦恼.
的除魅（disenchantment）过程，后现代主义也同样宣称了现代性已死，见证著人类历史的终结。
改革开放后，我们经历的世界是一个“去魅”(disenchantment)后“再入魅”(enchanting a disenchanted world)的过程：世俗化将伟人搬下 …

list.abs: M.韦伯就曾经把这种世界秩序的发现称之为“世界的解咒”(disenchantment of the world)。[19]
确如韦伯（M.Weber）著名的概括：现代社会已不再是神性信仰的时代，世界除魅（disenchantment of the world）化了。与此相应的 …

it was the German sociologist Max Weber who said that in the modern age we are witnessing the disenchantment of the world with the rise of science and the declining influence of religion .德国社会科学家马克斯·韦伯曾经说道在现代社会中，我们正在目睹社会的觉醒，并伴随着科学的崛起和宗教影响的减弱。

entry.def: Disenchantment is the feeling of being disappointed with something, and no longer believing that it is good or worthwhile.

example.ex: There's growing disenchantment with the Government.
example.tran: 大家对政府的幻想渐渐破灭了。

means.word_mean: 1. freeing from false belief or illusions

auth_sentence.content: They toured the store, Drexler's disenchantment mounting.
